all_response:
Jax: To survive here, you will need food and items to keep warm. You can use your digging skills to dig up some carrots from the mineral-rich mountains. To make your cloak cold-resistant, you will need to remove the current fire resistance enchantment, and re-enchant it to resist cold instead. Once you are prepared, you will need to reach the highest part of the mountain range to create a smoke signal so that the the nearby village can come and help you out of there.
Jax: Carrots only grow on the northern mountain range.
Jax: The western mountain range is rich in amethyst and it can be easily found there.
Jax: You should head to the highest parts of the eastern mountain range as its the only place where the villagers might be able to see you.

all_response:
Jax: An unthinkable apocalypse has happened and you need to survive in what is left of a desolate and barely inhabited world. To survive, you will need to head to the the refuge. After crossing the Great River Bridge, you will see a forest; passing through the forest will lead to the refuge, you will see your destination. Before you set off, you should retrieve the supplies I've stored for you to use on the way.
Jax: I've hidden the supplies behind the second cabinet on the right-hand side as you enter the old abandoned grocery store.
Jax: You can show the pendant with the special totem to the guard at the Great River Bridge, which should allow you to cross the bridge.
Jax: You will need to traverse the tropical rainforest, which is the only way to get to the refuge.

all_response:
Jax: You are in a post-apocalyptic environment, desolate and uninhabited. To survive in this world, you need to head to the refuge, a human settlement. After crossing the great river bridge, you will see a forest; passing through the forest that leads to the refuge, you will see your destination. Before you set off, go retrieve the dry food and bottled water I've stored for use on the road.
Jax: I've hidden the dry food behind the second cabinet on the right as you enter the abandoned grocery store.
Jax: I've hidden the bottled water in the second classroom on the first floor of the abandoned school building.
Jax: You can show the pendant with the special totem to the guard at the Great River Bridge, which should allow you to cross the bridge. The other items you have are not of particular use at the moment, but you might need them in the future.
Jax: You will need to traverse the tropical rainforest, which is the only way to get to the refuge.

all_response:
Jax: You are trapped deep in the icy wastelands. To survive here, you will need food and items to keep warm. You can use your digging skills to dig up carrots in places where they can be found. Wearing a cloak with fire properties can help keep you warm with the heat it emits. Once you are prepared, you will need to reach the highest part of the mountain range to create a smoke signal so that people from the nearby village can come and rescue us.
Jax: The dragon cloak possesses fire properties.
Jax: You should head to the highest parts of the eastern mountain range as its the only place where the villagers might be able to see you.
Jax: Magic crystals can be found in the frozen swamp, but you will need to dig for them.
Jax: There are plenty of carrots in the frozen grove, but you will need to dig for them.

all_response:
Jax: You are trapped on a deserted island. To survive here, you'll need to make sure you have food, water, and shelter. You can collect wild fruits in the forest. A lot of junk washes up on the beach, maybe some of it can be used to make a tent.
Jax: Clean water can be found at the source in the rocky mountains. You can use an empty pot to collect it.
Jax: I saw waterproof cloths needed for making tents washed up on the east coast.
Jax: I saw ropes needed for making tents washed up on the west coast.
Jax: The tropical rainforest is full of wild fruit. You can collect some there but you mustn't go near the misty jungle as the fog there is poisonous.

Jax: You are stranded on a desert island. To survive here, you'll need to make sure you have food, water, and shelter. You can collect wild fruits in the forest. A lot of junk also washes up on the beach, maybe some of it can be used to make a tent. You'll also need to create a smoke signal on the mountain top to make it easier for passing ships to spot us.

Jax: I saw waterproof cloths needed for making tents washed up on the east coast.

Jax: The tropical rainforest is full of wild fruit. You can collect some there but you mustn't go near the misty jungle as the fog there is poisonous.

all_response:
Jax: You are stranded on a desert island after our ship was destroyed in a storm. You are stranded on a deserted island. To survive here, we'll need to make sure we have food, water, and shelter. I'll take care of the water, and you should collect some food. Besides, you should create a shelter and set up a tent by the creek on the east coast. I saw that the ship's wireless communication devices and batteries washed up on the beach. If we link them up, we can send a distress signal and we'll have a strong chance of getting rescued.
Jax: I saw that the wireless communication equipment washed up on the east coast. It looks like it will still work but it won't power on without batteries.
Jax: I saw that some batteries have washed up on the west coast.
Jax: It looks like some fabric has blown in under the rocky mountains. We can use that to make a tent.
Jax: I saw some ropes washed in at the edge of the forest.
Jax: They were at the edge of the tropical rainforest. Be careful not to go near the misty jungle as the fog there is poisonous.
